meanings.definition: Awkwardly solid or bulky in form or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The old computer was so clunky, it took up too much space on the desk.
meanings.sent2: Her clunky shoes made it difficult for her to walk gracefully.
meanings.sent3: The clunky robot tried to dance but kept bumping into things.
meanings.sent4: The clunky furniture in the room made it feel cramped and crowded.
meanings.sent5: The clunky car struggled to navigate the narrow streets of the old town.

meanings.sent1: The clunky machinery in the factory could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The clunky metal gate swung open with a loud clanking sound.
meanings.sent3: The clunky old clock chimed every hour, waking up the entire house.
meanings.sent4: The clunky chains on the swing set rattled in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The clunky pots and pans clanged together as she tried to put them away.

meanings.sent1: His clunky dance moves drew laughter from the audience.
meanings.sent2: The clunky handwriting on the board was hard to read.
meanings.sent3: She tried to walk in high heels but ended up looking clunky and awkward.
meanings.sent4: The clunky painting lacked the finesse of the artist's other works.
meanings.sent5: The clunky speech was filled with pauses and stumbles, making it hard to follow.
